metadata.titel_preek: Eleventh Sunday After Pentecost: Romans 8 / Trinity Sunday / Psalm 130

locutie.beschrijving: The preacher explains the context of Paul's agony over Corinth and the theological depth of Psalm 130. Content focuses on the nature of the Trinity as self-giving love and the human condition as 'miserable offenders' in need of mercy.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. Provides historical context (Paul's letter) and liturgical history (Book of Common Prayer changes).

illocutie.beschrijving: The sermon primarily functions as an ASSERTIVE explanation of God's character, occasionally shifting into COMMISSIVE blessing and DIRECTIVE reflection.
voorbeelden: The inmost being of God is a dynamic interrelatedness.
This is the movement of Psalm 130.
I may leave you today with renewed confidence.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To instill a sense of security in God's love and a humble recognition of the need for forgiveness.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Moderate. The Spirit is mentioned as part of the Trinitarian formula, but the Spirit's current work in the preaching event is not explicitly invoked.

voorbeelden: The Corinthian church has gone completely off the rails.
God’s love spends itself to the very last drop.
There is no human being who can come up with enough credits.
Imagine for a moment that you are the parent.
Think about those people who have borne with you.
The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ... be with you all.
He shall redeem Israel from all his iniquities.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Strong when quoting liturgy/scripture, but the preacher's own voice often retreats into describing the promise rather than speaking it.

voorbeelden: I may leave you today with renewed confidence.
declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher relies on the authority of the quoted Benediction rather than an explicit 'I declare to you' stance.

indicatoren: Extensive use of 'Imagine' as a mental exercise rather than an address.
Talking about the history of the Prayer Book.
Explaining the 'movement' of the Psalm as an observer.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes a student of theology/liturgy rather than a participant in a divine encounter.

performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The grace remains a 'topic' to be understood rather than a 'gift' to be received.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: High quality but low frequency; mostly found in the liturgical frame.
voorbeelden: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ... be with you all.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address used for mental illustrations ('Imagine you are...').
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used more for pedagogical imagination than for sacramental address.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing Paul, the Corinthians, the Psalmist, and 'God' as an object of study.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a 'lecture' feel in the middle sections.

verleden_tijd.gebruik: Historical context of Paul and the Prayer Book.

actueel_present.gebruik: The closing blessing and the 'now' of worship.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Moves from the depth of sin (Assertive) to the promise of mercy (Commissive).
voorbeelden: None of us can hold up our heads... May God grant... we all together might go forth in the joyous knowledge.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: The pattern is present but weakened by the high volume of 'talking about' the pattern.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: With the Lord there is mercy... therefore go forth.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon is a brilliant theological essay that explains the performative power of the Trinity and the Psalm, but often stops just short of being the event itself.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The inmost being of God is a dynamic interrelatedness.
sterke_punten.effect: Provides a solid intellectual foundation for faith.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: There used to be a way of teaching all this from the Book of Common Prayer.
zwakke_punten.probleem: Historical analysis delays the direct address of the Gospel.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The sermon 'happens' most clearly in the final paragraph where the blessing is invoked.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The sermon explains the sacrament of the Word more than it enacts it.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Implicitly, through the reading of the Psalm.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: The preacher acts as a teacher/guide rather than a direct herald.
tekstueel_bewijs: I may leave you today... invoking with renewed faith the apostolic blessing.

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Yes, as a member of the Trinity.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: The prayer at the end leaves the work to God.
tekstueel_bewijs: May God grant that not a single one of us...

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: The preacher views the 'blessing' as the means of grace.
sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: Moderate. The description of God's love is radiant.
tekstueel_bewijs: Human love is a glimmer of the full radiance of God’s love.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Too many 'is' and 'was' verbs. Need more 'gives', 'forgives', and 'promises'.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: God’s love spends itself to the very last drop.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Today, God pours out His love for you, down to the last drop of His Son's blood.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a general truth to a present-tense gift.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is often quoted from the text rather than spoken by the preacher.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Use 'I' and 'You' more boldly in the proclamation of mercy.
voorbeeldzinnen: I announce to you today: there is forgiveness with God for you.
You, who are in the depths today, hear this...

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The balance is actually quite good.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Keep the indicative strong but make it more performative.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A deeply thoughtful and orthodox sermon that would gain immense power by shifting from 'talking about' the Trinity to 'delivering' the Trinitarian life to the hearer.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SAT reveals that the 'Blessing' is not just a 'relationship signal' but a reality-changing declaration.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: The power here is not in the 'parent' metaphor (rhetoric) but in the 'Apostolic Blessing' (illocution).
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT identifies that the sermon's peak is the Benediction, which functions as a Declarative act.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ... be with you all.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: The most performative moment of the text.

appendices.notities: The sermon is highly liturgical and relies on the 'force' of the Prayer Book and Scripture to do the performative work.
